description: Describes a file transfer protocol-enabled server that you specify by passing the ServerId parameter. The response contains a description of a server's properties. When you set EndpointType to VPC, the response will contain the EndpointDetails.

parameters.name: ServerId
parameters.description: A system-assigned unique identifier for a server.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: Specifies the unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server.

nested_items.name: Certificate
nested_items.description: Specifies the ARN of the Amazon Web ServicesCertificate Manager (ACM) certificate. Required when Protocols is set to FTPS.

nested_items.name: ProtocolDetails
nested_items.description: The protocol settings that are configured for your server.
To indicate passive mode (for FTP and FTPS protocols), use the PassiveIp parameter. Enter a single dotted-quad IPv4 address, such as the external IP address of a firewall, router, or load balancer.

To ignore the error that is generated when the client attempts to use the SETSTAT command on a file that you are uploading to an Amazon S3 bucket, use the SetStatOption parameter. To have the Transfer Family server ignore the SETSTAT command and upload files without needing to make any changes to your SFTP client, set the value to ENABLE_NO_OP. If you set the SetStatOption parameter to ENABLE_NO_OP, Transfer Family generates a log entry to Amazon CloudWatch Logs, so that you can determine when the client is making a SETSTAT call.
To determine whether your Transfer Family server resumes recent, negotiated sessions through a unique session ID, use the TlsSessionResumptionMode parameter.
As2Transports indicates the transport method for the AS2 messages. Currently, only HTTP is supported.

nested_items.name: Domain
nested_items.description: Specifies the domain of the storage system that is used for file transfers. There are two domains available: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) and Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS). The default value is S3.

nested_items.name: EndpointDetails
nested_items.description: The virtual private cloud (VPC) endpoint settings that are configured for your server. When you host your endpoint within your VPC, you can make your endpoint accessible only to resources within your VPC, or you can attach Elastic IP addresses and make your endpoint accessible to clients over the internet. Your VPC's default security groups are automatically assigned to your endpoint.

nested_items.name: AddressAllocationIds
nested_items.description: A list of address allocation IDs that are required to attach an Elastic IP address to your server's endpoint.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of subnet IDs that are required to host your server endpoint in your VPC.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VpcEndpointId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the VPC endpoint.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The VPC identifier of the VPC in which a server's endpoint will be hosted.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of security groups IDs that are available to attach to your server's endpoint.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EndpointType
nested_items.description: Defines the type of endpoint that your server is connected to. If your server is connected to a VPC endpoint, your server isn't accessible over the public internet.

nested_items.name: HostKeyFingerprint
nested_items.description: Specifies the Base64-encoded SHA256 fingerprint of the server's host key. This value is equivalent to the output of the ssh-keygen -l -f my-new-server-key command.

nested_items.name: IdentityProviderDetails
nested_items.description: Specifies information to call a customer-supplied authentication API. This field is not populated when the IdentityProviderType of a server is AWS_DIRECTORY_SERVICE or SERVICE_MANAGED.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: Provides the location of the service endpoint used to authenticate users.

nested_items.name: InvocationRole
nested_items.description: This parameter is only applicable if your IdentityProviderType is API_GATEWAY. Provides the type of InvocationRole used to authenticate the user account.

nested_items.name: DirectoryId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Directory Service directory that you want to use as your identity provider.

nested_items.name: Function
nested_items.description: The ARN for a Lambda function to use for the Identity provider.

nested_items.name: SftpAuthenticationMethods
nested_items.description: For SFTP-enabled servers, and for custom identity providers only, you can specify whether to authenticate using a password, SSH key pair, or both.
PASSWORD - users must provide their password to connect.
PUBLIC_KEY - users must provide their private key to connect.
PUBLIC_KEY_OR_PASSWORD - users can authenticate with either their password or their key. This is the default value.

PUBLIC_KEY_AND_PASSWORD - users must provide both their private key and their password to connect. The server checks the key first, and then if the key is valid, the system prompts for a password. If the private key provided does not match the public key that is stored, authentication fails.

nested_items.name: IdentityProviderType
nested_items.description: The mode of authentication for a server. The default value is SERVICE_MANAGED, which allows you to store and access user credentials within the Transfer Family service.

nested_items.name: LoggingRole
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows a server to turn on Amazon CloudWatch logging for Amazon S3 or Amazon EFS events. When set, you can view user activity in your CloudWatch logs.

nested_items.name: PostAuthenticationLoginBanner
nested_items.description: Specifies a string to display when users connect to a server. This string is displayed after the user authenticates.

nested_items.name: PreAuthenticationLoginBanner
nested_items.description: Specifies a string to display when users connect to a server. This string is displayed before the user authenticates. For example, the following banner displays details about using the system:

nested_items.name: Protocols
nested_items.description: Specifies the file transfer protocol or protocols over which your file transfer protocol client can connect to your server's endpoint. The available protocols are:
File Transfer Protocol): File transfer over SSH.
: File transfer with TLS encryption.
: Unencrypted file transfer.
: used for transporting structured business-to-business data.

nested_items.name: SecurityPolicyName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the security policy for the server.

nested_items.name: ServerId
nested_items.description: Specifies the unique system-assigned identifier for a server that you instantiate.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The condition of the server that was described. A value of ONLINE indicates that the server can accept jobs and transfer files. A State value of OFFLINE means that the server cannot perform file transfer operations.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Specifies the key-value pairs that you can use to search for and group servers that were assigned to the server that was described.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The name assigned to the tag that you create.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Contains one or more values that you assigned to the key name you create.

nested_items.name: UserCount
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of users that are assigned to a server you specified with the ServerId.

nested_items.name: WorkflowDetails
nested_items.description: Specifies the workflow ID for the workflow to assign and the execution role that's used for executing the workflow.

nested_items.name: OnUpload
nested_items.description: A trigger that starts a workflow: the workflow begins to execute after a file is uploaded.

nested_items.name: WorkflowId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the workflow.

nested_items.name: ExecutionRole
nested_items.description: Includes the necessary permissions for S3, EFS, and Lambda operations that Transfer can assume, so that all workflow steps can operate on the required resources.

nested_items.name: OnPartialUpload
nested_items.description: A trigger that starts a workflow if a file is only partially uploaded. You can attach a workflow to a server that executes whenever there is a partial upload.

nested_items.name: WorkflowId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the workflow.

nested_items.name: ExecutionRole
nested_items.description: Includes the necessary permissions for S3, EFS, and Lambda operations that Transfer can assume, so that all workflow steps can operate on the required resources.

nested_items.name: StructuredLogDestinations
nested_items.description: Specifies the log groups to which your server logs are sent.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: S3StorageOptions
nested_items.description: Specifies whether or not performance for your Amazon S3 directories is optimized. This is disabled by default.

nested_items.name: DirectoryListingOptimization
nested_items.description: Specifies whether or not performance for your Amazon S3 directories is optimized. This is disabled by default.

nested_items.name: As2ServiceManagedEgressIpAddresses
nested_items.description: The list of egress IP addresses of this server. These IP addresses are only relevant for servers that use the AS2 protocol. They are used for sending asynchronous MDNs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: IpAddressType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to use IPv4 only, or to use dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) for your Transfer Family endpoint. The default value is IPV4.
